comments.comment: I listened to this conversation climbing a hill to watch the sunrise on the first day of 2024. I was cold with my shorts on, runny nose, freezing hands and shoulders shaking. The sun rose above the horizon burning the clouds away. I was in tears listening to David because I truly understood what my potentials are. I lost 9kg of fat just doing zone 2 running in 8 wild weeks. My mental acuity sky rocketed and was ready to kick it to the next level and this podcast happened at the right moment.   My hands were freezing cold coming down the hill but my heart was filled with something profound.   From today on, I plan to do what I hate doing and grow some fucking anterior midcingular cortex. Thank you David. 2:07:10

comments.comment: I can attest to the part at 1:16:45 . a few years ago I went from 430 pounds down to 260 I was still heavy but I was in way better shape, able to do martial arts etc. I gained it all back up to 560 ,through diet and exercise I got myself down to 489 and I‚Äôm on my way to the gym right now at six in the morning. I‚Äôm in pain every day it hurts just to get out of bed. Sometimes. And the depression is real. I gotta convince myself it‚Äôs worth getting up every day but at the end always just remind myself the world doesn‚Äôt care still gotta pay your bills still gotta take care of your family and then I just get up and go.

comments.comment: Skip the first 8:00 minutes and avoid the unnecessary long winded intro...  I'm 1.5 hours into this interview and David Goggins isn't sharing any new info.  Everything he's saying we've already heard from him before.  If you're a fan of David Goggins, you can skip this interview.  But if it's your first time listening to him, it's worth a listen.  Just my honest feedback and trying to save people some time.

They think that we have some hack that keeps us going, or as Goggins said "gifted strong mind", but in reality if you go through it, you adapt to it, and it becomes a normal part of your life. Putting his body under such stress daily might seem out of this world to a lot of individuals, but his body and mind have adapted.
